channel.title: Automation Kit for Power Platform
channel.description: Recent content on Automation Kit for Power Platform

item.title: Authoring guidelines
item.description: The following sections outline guidelines and notes for authoring starter documentation. Guidelines Goals Source Control Design Guidelines Home Page Reuse Markdown Pages shortcodes Table of Contents Question External Image Notes GitHub Pages Setup Update Home Page Image Badge Question and Answer Question Why was Hugo selected? Question Why did you not select some other static site generator? Question Why was Microsoft Forms not used for questions? Question Why GitHub pages to host content?

item.title: Authoring Questions
item.description: This page contains information the format used to author interactive questions that are included as part of the Automation Kit for Power Platform starter. Getting Started Embedding questions in you content Custom Functions len contains Custom Widgets Image Task Question and Answer Question Why has this approach been used rather than Microsoft Forms? Question What advantages are there of this approach? Question Could this approach be used within a Power App or Power Page?

item.title: Automation Maturity Model
item.description: Status: Work In Progress - Under Review Use the questions below determine your automation maturity model and discover how the Automation Kit for Power Platform or other related solutions can help you improve your automation maturity using the Power Platform. JavaScript must be enabled to view this content

item.title: Contribute to the documentation
item.description: Status: Work In Progress - Under Review Learn how to start making a contribution to the starter documentation for the Automation Kit for Power Platform. Setup You can use the questions below to guide your setup and contribution experience JavaScript must be enabled to view this content

item.title: Contribution
item.description: As an Open Source project built on top of the Power Platform and Microsoft Cloud our goal is to rapidly provide tools and guidance to help accelerate your hyper automation journey. As part of this journey as we incubate, mature and collaborate with the Core Power Platform engineering team based on your feedback. Using this feedback we will look to include learnings in the core product to improve and respond to your needs.

item.title: Customer Stories
item.description: Introduction Want to see how customers or partners have used with the Automation Kit for Power Platform? This page will reference public customer stories and feedback using the Automation Kit for Power Platform. Cineplex Read more on the Cineplex digital transformation with Power Automate RPA led by citizen developers story.

item.title: Documentation Site Configuration
item.description: In the gh-pages branch the there is a site/config.yaml file. This file contains key configuration that can be updated. You can refer to hugo-fresh/config.yaml at master https://www.github.com/StefMa/hugo-fresh (github.com) for examples. Key attributes include baseUrl title params: description navbarlogo logo - Note the file should be in static/images/logo link hero title subtitle buttonlink navbar - Change titles and links section2 - Change your product and features section3 - Update to reflect key images text

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions
item.description: Introduction This page contains a set of frequently asked questions related to the Automation Kit for Power Platform. If you cannot find an answer to a question you have consider creating a Feature Request to update this page. Question groups in this page: Getting Started Question: What is the best way for me to get started? Support Question: How do I get support installing or operating the Automation Kit for Power Platform?

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Introduction Getting started can be one of the key blockers to evaluating and using the Automation Kit for Power Platform in your organization. You can use the interactive form below to step you through the getting started process. You can also use the Introduction of the learning content to provide an overview of the Automation Kit for Power Platform. The Automation Center of Excellence strategy with the Automation Kit for Power Platform can also be used to provide context on how the Automation Kit for Power Platform can help your Automation Center of Excellence.

item.title: Give Feedback
item.description: Looking to contribute your feedback to the Automation Kit for Power Platform? You can use the sections below to explore the different feedback types. Give Kudos Report a Bug or submit a Feature Request Look for an existing issue Submitting your Issue Other Ways to Contribute? Give Kudos Want to share some feedback on the Automation Kit for Power Platform or a feature and the impact it has had for you?

item.title: History
item.description: This page includes links to past and future office hours sessions October 2022

item.title: Install Checklist
item.description: ðŸŽ¥ Want to a more visual presentation of the end to end process and install steps? Review our Automation Kit for Power Platform Video Playlist for prerequisites, solution install and Automation Kit for Power Platform usage. If you are looking to try or install the Automation Kit for Power Platform, you can use the questions below to guide your install process JavaScript must be enabled to view this content

item.title: Milestones
item.description: Notes about Automation Kit for Power Platform milestones Milestone progress can be tracked in the Automation Kit - GitHub Project Milestones are a guide only and not a committed timeline Features or bugs may not ship in each milestone due to priority bugs or features Features or bugs that are not included in a release will be considered for inclusion in the next milestone Office Hours will be use to share roadmap and assist with prioritization of new features and bugs to include in each milestone

item.title: Naming
item.description: Alongside the month and version numbers the Automation Kit for Power Platform uses a code name tag each release. Generation Process Install node dependencies npm install Add the following node sample as file named index.mjs import {generateName} from '@criblinc/docker-names' const dockerName = generateName(); console.log(dockerName); Run the sample node index.mjs

item.title: November 2022 Release
item.description: The November release (sharp-archimedes) of the Automation Kit for Power Platform is the third public preview release. This release is expected to include bug fixes and a focus on improving the installation experience. Stretch goals that may be included based on priority and customer feedback: CoE Kit ALM Accelerator integration samples Get Started Try out Get Started Guide or join our Office Hours Prior Release October 2022 (upbeat-dhawan) Next Release December 2022 (zealous-antonelli) Project Milestone Automation Kit - November 2022

item.title: October 2022 Release
item.description: The October release (upbeat-dhawan) of the Automation Kit for Power Platform is the second public preview release. This release is a documentation only release and the release assets remain unchanged since the September release. Get Started Try out Get Started Guide or join our Office Hours Prior Release September 2022 (vibrant-elion) Next Release November 2022 (sharp-archimedes) Project Milestone Automation Kit - October 2022 Review the Milestone Notes for further information

item.title: Office Hours
item.description: Register ðŸ“† Register for our office hours session https://aka.ms/ak4ppofficehours Visit our October 2022 landing page for more information and give feedback. History Visit our History page for links to previous / planned office hours. Tell Me More This meeting is a regular forum for customers and partners to learn and ask questions about the Automation Kit for Power Platform. Come prepared to ask questions about existing features, learn how something works and new features you’d like to see.

item.title: Office Hours
item.description: Welcome to the Automation Kit for Power Platform October 2022 office hours landing page. You can register for the office hours session https://aka.ms/ak4ppofficehours to be held on Tuesday 11th October 2022 between 7:00AM and 8:00AM PDT (See other times timezones https://aka.ms/ak4pp-times). If you have you already registered, you can forward this page or the registration link to others you feel may be interested. Office Hours Format Each office hours session is an hour long and has the following format:

item.title: Release
item.description: The page contains links to the release history for the Automation Kit for Power Platform. Each release will name a unique code name assigned to make the release identification more memorable. To learn more about the name generation process read Release Naming. 2022 Planned November 2022 - (sharp-archimedes) December 2022 - (zealous-antonelli) Released October 2022 - (upbeat-dhawan) September 2022 - (vibrant-elion)

item.title: RPA Migration
item.description: The Automation Kit for Power Platform Migration module provides you a proven set of tools and guidance based on engagements with customers to accelerate your migration journey. By leveraging the strength of Microsoft Power Platform, Microsoft Azure and the wider Microsoft Cloud services you can: Realize your goals of providing cost savings. Providing the guardrails to plan, migrate, monitor and setup for a operations model for ongoing usage. Leverage conversion samples that you can customize to your process to meet your migration needs.

item.title: RPA Migration
item.description: The Automation Kit provides a set of low code and Microsoft Cloud tools and guidance to assist you with your RPA Migration journey. The Automation Kit Migration module builds on our experience of working with existing customers to help them migrate existing solutions to the Power Platform Robotic Process Automation (RPA). By using the Migration Module of the Automation kit you can accelerate your path to provide cost savings and visibility to your organization.

item.title: September 2022 Release
item.description: The September release (vibrant-elion) of the Automation Kit for Power Platform is the first public preview release. Get Started Try out Get Started Guide or join our Office Hours Prior Release Private private previews Next Release October 2022 (upbeat-dhawan) Key Notes Key notes for the September 2022 release: For customers upgrading from the April private preview release the Private Preview Upgrade include notes on steps required to unregister plugin actions no longer required in the September public preview release.

item.title: Setup Automation Kit Power BI dashboard
item.description: To launch the Power BI Dashboard for the Automation Center of Excellence, you will require the environment URL for your Main environment (Where Automation CoE Main is installed). To obtain the environment URL, navigate to the Power Platform Admin Center, go to Environments, select the environment, and note the Environment URL: Enter the environment URL upon launching the Power BI template which you have downloaded from the Automation Kit for Power Platform releases

item.title: Support
item.description: Getting Started The Getting Started Guidance provides some interactive questions to link you to sources of information that could help you to get started. Getting further support Guidance on getting further support for the Automation Kit for Power Platform: Refer to our Feedback and support page for general guidance Use our Automation Kit Learn pages to step through the install and usage instructions Use the Automation Kit Issues templates for search for known Bugs / Feature gaps.

item.title: Unregister
item.description: Please use the question below to cancel your auto registration for Automation Kit for Power Platform. We will send you a confirmation code that you can use to confirm unregistration JavaScript must be enabled to view this content
